field_edited_text.value:
Maryland Port Administration

Maryland Port Administration’s 550 acre Dundalk Marine Terminal

e i

& & e o - ® s L
9 B :; ‘ A :

Other general cargo and container
terminals in Canton are NBC’s Boston
Street Terminal and the Canton Marine
Terminal, each of which move approx-
imately 4 percent of the port’s total
tonnage.

*Central Soya Finance Corp., a firm

based in Fort Wayne, Indiana, owns
and operates a grain export facility on
Newgate Street in south Canton. The
facility moves thousands of tons of
corn, meal, and wheat through the
port each year.

*National Gypsum operates a pier

located at the foot of Newkirk Street
for the import of Gypsum rock.

*The Rukert Terminals Corp. operates

two bulk cargo facilities along Clinton
Street in west Canton and is currently
constructing covered storage structures
on a 9-acre site. The company primar-
ily handles ferro-alloys, potash, ferro-
nickel, zinc, and copper. A new head-
quarters building and an extension of
its pier from 500 to 800 feet were com-
pleted in 1979-80.

*Conrail operates a coal pier on Clinton

Street. The pier is used to load barges
for local and intracoastal deliveries.
The yards serving this pier were
recently reconstructed to accommo-
date Interstate-95 in Canton. This facil-
ity provides coal to Bethlehem Steel
and several utilities in Delaware and
New Jersey.

*Maryland Port Administration owns the

Clinton Street Marine Terminal which
handles both general cargo and con-
tainerized freight.

*Exxon Corp. owns and operates a large

petroleum terminal and storage facility.
The Exxon installation deals extensively
in residual fuel oil used to fire power
plants and other large industrial boil-
ers. Because of its thickness, this oil
cannot be moved by pipeline but must
be moved by ship and barge.

*Apex Oil and Petroleum Marketing

Corp. which distributes both distillates
and residual fuel oil, maintains a
terminal and distribution facility
immediately south of Exxon on Clinton
Street. Apex Oil purchased the former

ASARCO plant for a future bulk storage

facility.

Apex and Exxon storage and distribu-
tion facilities cover over 200 acres in
northwest Canton.





40
